title: Build a Valentine website for Ahana & Suvo with cute animations and multi-theme styles

requirements.text: Replace the current Isabella voice companion landing experience with a dedicated Valentine website page for Ahana from Suvo, making this Valentine page the default rendered route in the app.

quotes: Make a valentine website for my gf “ahana” make special animations cute and pretty web and some cute gestures just build it now.

acceptanceCriteria: Opening the app shows the Valentine website content (not the Isabella voice companion UI).
The existing Isabella/VoiceCompanionPage code remains in the codebase (not deleted), but it is not the default entry page.

requirements.text: Ensure the names “Ahana” and “Suvo” appear together throughout the Valentine website (e.g., headers, love note, CTA text, success/celebration state, and any repeating labels), using consistent formatting (for example: “Ahana & Suvo”).
acceptanceCriteria: All major visible sections of the Valentine website include both names together (not only one name).
No section displays only “Ahana” without also displaying “Suvo” (except where grammatically necessary, in which case both names must still appear prominently in the same section).

requirements.text: Implement cute/pretty Valentine animations and “cute gestures” on the Valentine website, including at minimum: a floating hearts layer, a sparkles/particles layer, and a celebratory effect when the user accepts (e.g., confetti burst). All animations must respect the user’s “prefers-reduced-motion” setting by significantly reducing or disabling motion.

quotes: Make a valentine website for my gf “ahana” make special animations cute and pretty web and some cute gestures just build it now.

acceptanceCriteria: The Valentine page visibly shows floating hearts and sparkle/particle effects when motion is allowed.
A clear celebration animation (e.g., confetti burst) triggers on an explicit positive user action (e.g., clicking “Yes”).
When the OS/browser prefers-reduced-motion is enabled, the page avoids continuous motion (hearts/particles/confetti are disabled or substantially minimized).

requirements.text: Add an interactive Valentine proposal moment/flow on the Valentine website that culminates in a clear “Yes” acceptance outcome and shows a personalized success message that includes both “Ahana” and “Suvo”. Include at least one playful micro-interaction (“cute gesture”), such as a button hover reaction, a short step-by-step reveal, or a small surprise reveal section.

quotes: Make a valentine website for my gf “ahana” make special animations cute and pretty web and some cute gestures just build it now.

acceptanceCriteria: The page contains an explicit proposal CTA (e.g., “Will you be my Valentine?”) with a “Yes” action.
After clicking “Yes”, the UI transitions to a celebration/success state that includes both names together.
At least one additional interactive micro-interaction exists beyond clicking “Yes” (e.g., a reveal, step flow, or playful button behavior).

requirements.text: Provide a theme/style selector on the Valentine website that lets the user switch between these four visual styles: (1) cute pink hearts everywhere, (2) floating hearts + sparkles, (3) anime theme, and (4) elegant romantic red theme. Theme changes should update colors/typography/decoration consistently across the page.
acceptanceCriteria: A visible theme selector control exists on the Valentine page.
Switching themes clearly changes the overall look (palette and/or decorative treatment) while keeping content and functionality intact.
All four named themes are available and selectable.

requirements.text: Establish and apply a coherent Valentine visual design system across the Valentine website (colors, typography, spacing, buttons, cards/sections) with a cute romantic aesthetic (avoid blue/purple by default). Keep all user-facing text in English.

quotes: Make a valentine website for my gf “ahana” make special animations cute and pretty web and some cute gestures just build it now.
Use English for any user-facing text in the build request.

acceptanceCriteria: The Valentine website uses a consistent romantic design (e.g., pink/peach/red tones, soft gradients, rounded elements, cohesive typography).
No user-facing UI copy appears in a language other than English.
Design looks intentional and consistent across all sections and states (default, hover, success/celebration).

requirements.text: Update the document title and meta description in the HTML entry point to reflect the Valentine website for Ahana & Suvo (instead of Isabella branding).

quotes: Make a valentine website for my gf “ahana” make special animations cute and pretty web and some cute gestures just build it now.

acceptanceCriteria: Browser tab title reflects the Valentine website and includes both names (Ahana and Suvo).
Meta description references a Valentine website experience (not Isabella/AI companion).

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only).
Do not edit immutable hook files: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor; do not introduce additional backend services.
nonGoals: Do not add third-party authentication providers (only Internet Identity exists, and it is not required for this Valentine site).
Do not add external AI/LLM integrations or any server-side chat logic.
Do not implement real-time features (WebSockets/push notifications).
No requirement to store user data persistently on-chain for this Valentine website unless explicitly requested later.
